docs.title: 🚀 Gemini-Powered Auto Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the future of developer productivity! This tool:

  • Detects new Python code
  • Documents it using Google's Gemini
  • Builds a beautiful static site with MkDocs
  • Deploys instantly via GitHub Pages

💡 Just push code, and your docs update like magic.

docs.title: even_or_odd Program
docs.text:
=====================

This program checks whether a user-provided number is even or odd.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The main function prompts the user to enter a number and determines whether it is even or odd.

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text: • Prints a message to the console indicating whether the number is even or odd.

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
# Ask the user for a number
num = int(input("Enter a number: "))

# Check if the number is even or odd
if num % 2 == 0:
    print("The number is even.")
else:
    print("The number is odd.")

Note: This program does not have a defined main function, but rather a sequence of statements that are executed when the script is run. The above documentation is provided for clarity and convenience.

docs.title: Documentation for hello.py
docs.text: There is no function or class in the provided Python code, so there is nothing to document. The code simply prints the string "hello" to the console.
